alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 3:42PM MDT until September 13 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 342 PM MDT, Capitol Reef National Park rangers have reported flash flooding in Grand Wash and Sulphur Creek. SR-24 between Hickman Bridge and Grand Wash is impassable due to a debris flow. Between 0.50 and 1.25 inches of rain has fallen. The heaviest rainfall has been falling in portions Sulphur Creek, Cohab Canyon, and Grand Wash. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Capitol Reef National Park ranger reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes and slot canyons. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
